main.name: Silly Squares Club
main.bio: Silly Squares Club began as just a silly idea Jim had one day after hearing yet again about some generative art NFT collection that was simply "images on the blockchain". While Silly Squares is silly on the surface, it pushes the boundary of what's possible with NFTs and give holders exclusive access to hidden sections on this website, free swag, personalized consulting sessions with Jim, and more!
main.contactmessage: We'd love to hear from you! You can email us, call us, and even send us a postcard!

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

openSource.info: All the code for this website and the Silly Squares NFT collections are free and open-source, publicly released on Github with the GNU v3 General Public Lecense.

education.degree: A tribute to that summertime feeling.

work.title: Clean code that works
work.contractLink: Describe work, special projects, notable achievements, what technologies you have been working with, and anything else that would be useful for an employer to know.
work.description: Lead developer Jim Lynch has been studying and teaching Solidity coding and unit testing, and he practices what he preaches! This project is a living example of how to leverage the tools of Consensys, OpenZeppelin, and other great open-source projects to build something awesome and secure!

work.title: Say goodbye to gas fees
work.contractLink: Describe work, special projects, notable achievements, what technologies you have been working with, and anything else that would be useful for an employer to know.
work.description: ALL Silly Squares NFTs have been deployed on the Polygon blockchain, a layer 2 Ethereum blockchain. The key advantage of this is that gas costs to trade and list these NFTs are INSANELY LOW! (like less than one cent USD per transaction).
